articles.title: Wildfire smoke blankets BC and Alberta, prompting air quality advisories
articles.description: About 25 new wildfires were sparked between Monday morning and midday Tuesday

articles.title: Vancouver's English Bay and Sunset Beach reopen to swimming after water quality improves
articles.description: Beaches that were closed in Vancouver due to high levels of bacteria have since been reopened.

articles.title: Victoria police say explicit phone calls aimed at women provincewide
articles.description: VICTORIA — Police in Victoria say they have received more than 50 reports of unwanted sexually explicit phone calls aimed at female employees of local businesses.Police say the calls are happening in. . .

articles.title: The Latest: Polls close in Vermont for slate of primaries
articles.description: WASHINGTON — The Latest on primaries in Connecticut, Minnesota, Vermont and Wisconsin (all times local):8:05 p.m.Independent U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders has won Vermont’s Democratic Senate…

articles.title: Ontario government caps summer session and size of Toronto council
articles.description: TORONTO — The Ontario government passed legislation Tuesday to cut Toronto’s “dysfunctional” city council in time for the October 22 municipal election.Bill 5, the Better Lo…

articles.author: Colleen Barry and Danica Kirka
articles.title: Italian bridge collapse sends cars plunging, killing 26
articles.description: A 51-year-old highway bridge in the Italian port city of Genoa collapsed in a driving rain Tuesday, killing at least 26 people and injuring 15 others as it sent dozens of vehicles tumbling into a heap of concrete and twisted steel.

articles.title: Defence rests without calling Paul Manafort or any witnesses to the stand
articles.description: Attorneys for Paul Manafort rested their case on Tuesday without calling any witnesses, including the former Trump campaign chairman himself, who told the judge he did not want to testify in his own defense against bank and tax fraud charges.

articles.title: Quebec to reimburse costs of attending trials for families of crime victims
articles.description: MONTREAL — Close friends and relatives of homicide victims can soon be compensated for costs associated with attending the killer’s trial, Quebec’s justice minister announced Tues…

articles.title: Eco-friendly open-air urinals cause uproar in Paris
articles.description: An attempt by officials in Paris to tackle public urination by installing open-air urinals, or "uritrottoirs," has outraged some residents of the French capital.

articles.title: Woman and her dog are missing after hike near BC's Jumbo Pass
articles.description: A woman and her dog have disappeared during a hike in Jumbo Pass in British Columbia’s southeast.

articles.title: Nebraska executes inmate using powerful opioid fentanyl
articles.description: LINCOLN, Neb. – Nebraska carried out its first execution in more than two decades on Tuesday with a drug combination never tried before, including the first use of the powerful opioid fentanyl in a lethal injection. Carey Dean Moore, 60, was pronounced dead a…

articles.title: More than 1000 children abused by Pennsylvania priests, report says
articles.description: More than 1,000 children — and possible many more — were molested by hundreds of Roman Catholic priests in six Pennsylvania dioceses, while senior church officials took steps to cover it up, according to a landmark grand jury report.

articles.title: Enshrine right to housing in law, feds urged
articles.description: Federal legislation needed to declare housing a 'right,' says coalition

articles.title: UK police treating crash on Parliament that injured three people as 'terrorist incident'

articles.author: Patrick Cain
articles.title: Here's how to turn off Google's other tracking feature that you didn't know about
articles.description: Many were surprised Monday by another little-known Google feature that tracks their location,. Here's how to turn it off.

articles.title: BC Christian university drops sex covenant criticized as discriminatory
articles.description: A Christian university in British Columbia has decided to drop a requirement that students sign a “community covenant” that forced them to abstain from sex outside heterosexual marriage.

articles.author: Josh K. Elliott
articles.title: Here's the fake news Saudi Arabia is playing about Canada
articles.description: Saudi Arabia's state-owned television network has falsely claimed that Canada imprisoned several individuals over "freedom of opinion," including psychologist Jordan Peterson.

articles.author: Marilisa Racco
articles.title: Calgary, Vancouver and Toronto make top 10 most livable cities list
articles.description: Canada boasts three cities on the world's top 10 most liveable centres based on criteria that includes healthcare, stability and education.
